description: the best investment i ever did. This is a must at my office, it's a must to make my job great now.
A little bit heavy on the resource usage side, but other then that it works like a charm.
nothing to add. Better than GitKraken - only git Bash.
Version 6 is so much faster, too. \o/
wow, nothing to say, offers many more features than github desktop and is faster. The Glo board is simply amazing

Recent-ish(?) change requires you to pay for a subscription to open/work in private repos. It has some great features but nothing that sticks out when compared to free alternatives; at least not anything worthy of the cost. Glo Boards are nothing spectacular either(again, free alternatives) so I have no use for them. Allow free version to open/work in private repos again and I'll come back. Till then, this app is useless to me.
summary: Was great till private repos require sub

description:
The entire process for getting it setup and linked to github was really easy. They even have an app on the ios and android store to help manage your konban boards (for people familiar with Trello, Jira and Github). 

I think everything about Kraken is awesome. The interface itself is perfectly done. The team did a great job on it and the effort of everybody who had a hand in it shows. Kraken also has a cool icon. I guess I'm writing about my overall experience with Kraken. 

I'm going to stick with it and see how it goes for a month but as of now I'm REALLY impressed. I'm pretty picky about apps so that says a lot.
money money money money money money
summary: it was ok, now it is not ok)

description:
Now for opening local hosted repositories you need to buy a license.
RIP Gitkraken.
Easy to use and intuitive

I was okay with a freemium-style model where I could not use private repos without paying (I only wanted it for open source). I was even prepared to sign up for an account. But then I had to sign up to the EULA and it had a bunch of things like having to keep audit records so they could check your usage etc. At that point I gave up and will uninstall.
summary: Installed, but EULA and creating the account were a bit much

description: its totally worth it. I have been using it for 2 years now and its awesome. Development team is amazing. It make entire git workflow so visual. I was always scared of merging or creating an issue with rebasing. Its saved us alot of headach.
summary: made my life so much easy

description: Does not support local private repository. Totally useless.
summary: Does not support local private repository

description: It's a great app, I would definitely recommend
well you cant access private repos
summary: well you cant access private repos

description:
I am dissapointed with this software, before it was great, but suddenly they changed to a pay model so so expensive, I use gitahead now, is 100% free and with all basic tools of gitkraken.

rest in peace for me kraken...
summary: It was a good tool but..

description: Cannot open a private repo unless I pay?

Nothing wrong with selling your appm but I only found out I can't use it with private repos after installing it and creating a profile (why do I need a GitKraken account to use a local app???). If this app would have been up front with pricing and made it clear it's a SUBSCRIPTION service before you can do anything useful at all with it, I may have used it.

As it is, though, pricing is deceptive and subscription only. Hard pass.
summary: Looks great, pricing is weird and hidden

description: Free version cannot open local repos, requires full access to GitHub. Useless.
summary: Free version cannot open local repos

description: The GUI is clean an inuative. In app editing is a great bonus.
Public only repo? Registration required? Metric tracking? For what?
summary: Too much work just to use an app for Public-Only Repos..

description: was fun and good as it was free. now its cost 50$ per year and they only accept credit card. why they hatin me that much.
Additionally, none of the subscription features I think are worth the price.
summary: Requires subscription to work on private github repos

description: Good graph, easy UI, friendly support
summary: The best UI Git client for Linux

description: Pretty GUI, too bad that it's behind a paywall for private repos.

description: It's OK, but I would prefer free alternatives.
Works only for public repoes

Great feature, but not compatible with private repos.
Good for open-sources works
The best git tool I have used
It's very good git client for linux (Ubuntu)

Free features are nice, but nothing spectatular.

I pay the tiny subscription fee and use it in my daily workflow. These reviews complaining about cost clearly aren't used to quality software. GitKraken is stable, looks great, full-featured, has git-integrated bug tracking and collab tools in the form of Glo Boards. Gits own tools are alright, but I prefer to avoid Microsoft as much as one can when they own Git itself. 

Give it a try, I've definitely had no complaints.
summary: Good app, you get what you pay for

description: Really useful
Only for public repositories

This is a great git GUI. The only bad reviews seem to come from whiny developers who can't seem to understand why someone would want to earn a living by selling a quality product instead of giving it away for free.
free for students btw
It's okay that it's not free for private repos, but it should be clearly stated.
Might even be better then SourceTree. That using it with private repos is behind a paywall is kind of a bummer.

description: doesnt run dont like app i cant use

Love it with all my heath
and with every update, that they add to the app, it make's it better.
It's quite a bit hard to understand, but after you get how it works is amazing
I use it more than a year now and I tried the other GUI clients but this is the most useable.
im using git kraken for three years in a row, never let me down

Needless to say, I chose the latter. And I'll uninstall the app next.

Uninstalled right away

description: It's not free for private repos

description: Doesn't replace the git commandline but is great for visualizing branches for rebases, checkouts, resets etc - and grabbing hashes. The default gui is just not as intuitive.

I love this app

Been using it for years, and i updated but no free plan anymore, GG
so, useless, they could limit the access to X repos at least...

Does not work with private repos
Require a gitkraken account to use it
great to resolve conflicts, merging , maintinging flow , cherry picking , reverting ........ basically : "anything git"
useless, as it crashes when trying to open a repo
If you're into visual Git clients, you won't be disappointed. Good visualizations, great interface, everything at a click's distance
Useless and not free.
Greedy bastards ...

Useless until you pay for a license unless you use public repos ie github. They only kept that option around as github offers a superior free client on Windows & OSX. They hope to trap developers early on and have been making moves to do so for years. Including the usual free student licenses in the hopes that they will find the effort to switch later in their careers to much hassle. It's the same route photoshop took in the past & to an extent still does. 

The main difference is that git clients are not particularly complex so switching is easy compared to photoshop.
mmmm terrible software
Extremely helpful.
Free tier is a joke

The kind of software and approach that I hate from the bottom of my heart. You cannot use it without an account. It's online only. I was looking for a standalone local git gui without a need for yet another account. I know that is less of a business opportunity for them, bit still. I mean git is meant to be used "online", but I want my freedom to host my repo wherever want, and even if it's github, I don't need a "middle man". Or a data/privacy leech service to go through.
I hate their business practices of signing me up for a trial automatically. I know that may get me used to using services that aren't available in the free version and it makes me more likely to sign up after the trial, but it is a sneaky business practice.
Also, they signed the welcome email as "Custumer Success Team". This kind of PR and marketing turns my stomach. Like if they could help my success in anyy way. They are after their own success, why lie, or pretend otherwise?
Revolting. I struggle to emphasise how much I hate this.
summary: Disgusting, pushy, expensive Software As A Service marketed as free

description:
It feels like they try to trick you into paying.
No problem with paying for a good software but don't try to trick me into it.
Terminal fan-boys/anti paid software, this is not for you.
free version is simply useless
If you want to access private repos, pay for it. OR install the older (but official) version 5.4.0 as in the tutorial by TheClockTwister presented on StackOverflow!
On FC 33. It crashes when you need to open a folder.
summary: Crash when trying to open a folder

description: And it works as expected.

User interface appears to be awesome at first but it's actually quite limited and clunky once you get past the honeymoon period. There are more powerful GUIs out there that are free.

It's a ~170 MB install. Compare that with Visual Studio Code that comes in at around the same size (and has a pretty decent Git GUI included).

You've got to be online for it to work and you need to create an account.

That's a lot of anti-patterns in one large package.
Annoying, wish they wouldn't do this sort of thing. Just give me the software or don't. Don't make me download to find that the free tier is a complete and utter joke.
summary: Not free yet marketed as such

description: It helps me manage well my repos and has a cool GitHub integration, but I use as Student.
you can use it only one week
summary: you can use it only one week

description: If you have pro account or some student or other access, it is a brilliant software.
This is one of the better git clients with a GUI. Perhaps a bit pricey, it is definitely worth it for professional use.
Really easy to use and intuitive Git editor. Have the premium version for two years already and I recommend you to get one too.

There is obvious difference between git repo from GitHub and git repo from self-hosted GitLab. At least for GitKraken. The difference is so big, that you cannot even open GitLab repo without paying for subscription. God-like business model, guys.
summary: Will there be lootboxes one day?

description: This is the best tool for fixing the merge issues... the best tool ever!
Can't even add private repo.. what a joke

i would have to pay if i want to use gitraken with my self hosted git repository. i will use an other app

description: Geh noch vie besser, reichlich Luft nach open!
a lot of different integrations and functions

Gitkraken ist optimal für die "Self-Hosting" Versionsverwaltung in FIrmen (aud dem Firmenserver), da es auf jedem Host-System läuft (Linux, Windows, Mac), so kann jeder auf seinem bevorzugten System arbeiten, egal ob von zuahseu auf dem Privatrechner oder den Büro-PCs. Die Lizenzkosten sind absolut fair und es kommen sehr regelmäßige Updates, die nicht nur Bugfixes sondern auch oft umfangreiche Erweiterungen enthalten.
summary: Beste Git-GUI Anwendung weit und breit

description:
Reason: The snap version does not work because it cannot configure /etc/gitconfig due to the SNAP issue.

The software itself is great, but use the deb file instead of the SNAP version
Gitrepos im Netzwerk können seit neustem nicht mehr geöffnet werden "The free version of GitKraken does not support opening private repositories"
summary: Nicht nutzbar mehr mit privaten GitRepos

description: I could not get my Yubikey working for gpg. I contacted the developer of the snap and they told me to use either the (inofficial) flatpak version or dev package. In the flatpak version the issue with the yubikey was fixed within an hour after submitting an issue on GitHub.
summary: Great, but support of flatpak version is much quicker and better

description: Klonen von privaten Repositories nicht mehr kostenlos möglich, Terminal ist schneller, einfacher und umfassender zu bedienen als dieses Programm
Zwangsregistrierung (oder den Schließen Button sehr gut versteckt) und keine native GUI, sieht daher leider furchtbar aus, zumindest soweit ich es ohne meine Daten anzugeben sehen konnte.
summary: Bin gar nicht erst zum Test gekommen

description:
Muy buena, creo que la interfaz es muy limpia y un gran abanico de funciones.
Lo malo es que no tiene un plan gratüito para repos privados.
summary: Para profesionales va de lujo, para indies y/o hobbist sirve a medias

description: GitKraken se trata de una de las mejores GUI para Git que hay. Su belleza y la cantidad de atajos de teclado que tiene hacen que sea un "must have" para cualquier programador. El único aspecto negativo es que se trata de código privativo y de pago, aunque tiene una versión gratuita que permite hacer todo lo imprescindible, salvo trabajar con repos privados de GitHub.
Para su uso debes entregar datos privados y acceso a tu cuenta github, no tiene sentido, para uso profesional no sirve.
excelente aplicación
Simplifica observar cambios y se sincroniza con tu cuenta de github

El hecho que use repositorios privados no quiere decir que sean comerciales, en fin para poder disfrutar de la app hay que pagar cuando antes era gratis. Deberían tener gratis por lo menos el manejo de uno a dos repositorios privados
summary: Funciona perfecto, pero hay que pagar

description: De lo mejor que existe para gestionar proyectos con git y gitflow de forma profesional.
summary: Gran aplicación para gestionar visualmente Git y Gitflow

description: Muy buena aplicación. Interfaz impecable.

Creí que era gratis, pero cuesta
al momento de hacer alguna exploracion a las carpetas dentro de la computadora se atora y se cierra
De pago para git privados

Esta bien, pero en mi Ubuntu 20.04 tardaba en abrir la aplicación y ahora ya ni siquiera abre. Reinstalé el programa y sigue sin solucionarse.

El programa es bueno pero ese detalle me detiene demasiado.
No deja emplear la aplicación si no estás dispuesto a crear una cuenta y dejar todos tus datos.
No te deja ver el arbol de git ni hacer nada si no pagas, las funcionalidades premium deberian ser aplicadas a otras cosas...
summary: Hay que pagar a partir de 7 dias

Comment peut-on mettre 1 étoile à un logiciel (très bon par ailleurs), en le justifiant par, "c'est payant" ?

C'est d'un ridicule. Tout le monde sait que c'est payant, la version gratuite vous permet de tester et/ou développer publiquement. C'est déjà très cool de leur part.

Не обновляется. Пишет "Gitkraken requires classic confinement". Гуглил, ничего не работало, абсолютно. Бред какой-то сделали. Пришлось в итоге удалить и переустановить.
Содержит в своём графическом интерфейсе кучу консольных команд git. А по визуализации веток для git не имеет равных себе.
Рекомендую. Правда.
Платная для приватных реп, а жалко...

- Хочет денег за работу с приватными репозитариями.
- Хочет много правд для работы с моим гитхаб-аккаунтом.
- Данные о моей работе утекут на сторону. Это самый главный и ОПРЕДЕЛЯЮЩИЙ минус

Использую Gitkraken ~ 1,5 года. За это время ни разу не подводил.
Приложение успешно работает на Ubuntu 18/20 64 bit.
+ Удобная работа с публичными git-репозиториями
+ Удобная система досок в стиле Trello.
+ Приятный и современный интерфейс.
+ Из Snap обновляется автоматически.
+ Разработчики отзывчивые, помогают (хоть и не сразу) при возникновении вопросов.

- В бесплатном режиме имеет некоторые ограничения. Но мне хватает всего того, что есть в бесплатной версии.
- На слабых и старых ПК может тормозить.
Проприетарная лицензия, нашел баг, написал разрабом, а мне ответили мы исправим если вы купите ...
Проприетарное говно
snapcraft не умеет делать бесплатные приложения, а равно тому, что творческая жилка у разработчиков отсутствует. Даже БГ (тьфу-тьфу-тьфу) стал выпускать бесплатные релизы.
plohoe prilogenie
Штучка очень помогла с Гитхабом, пока не вижу минусов. Безграничные настройки, может заменить ещё не доработанный GitHub Desktop, чем я собственно и воспользовался. Очень доволен сией вещью.
Отличное приложение. Есть все, что мне нужно.
nice app, nice functions, nice design
Он скачался, но не появился в списке программ. В настройках системы права и доступ приложений вместо его значка там знак кирпича.
платное то, что было бесплатно
算得上是 Electron App 中的典范了，难得可以免费用
